content.text: The children of two different bees will have a mixture of the genes of the two parents, and may even be a new species that you are yet to discover. By allowing these so called 'mutations' to occur, I discovered that these few species of naturally occuring bee opened up a world of possibilities, with many weird and exotic species to be found.

I will explain the many species that I discovered later on in the guide, along with tips to how I obtained them. A true apiarist never shares his secrets after all. From these bees and the other mundane species I discovered the Common and Cultivated bees. These bees are staples of any apiarist’s collection, and the common bee is considered the beginner apiarist’s badge of participation.

Although the common bee is not particularly interesting, its descendant the cultivated bee is fast working, producing more honey in a shorter amount of time. It also thinks anything but opera is underneath it, meaning it was *this* far away from being called the snobby bee.
